intro: Cycloptychis, commonly known as the spiral-leaf cycloptychis, is a unique genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and prefers well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale yellow, and it produces a fruit known as a schizocarp. Cycloptychis is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unusual morphology and limited distribution.
